sources.title: The Slime People (1963) PSYCHOTRONIC
sources.description:
It's Friday@PizzaFLIX
Director: Robert Hutton
Stars: Robert Hutton, Susan Hart, Les Tremayne

They came from the bowels of Los Angeles: grotesque, rotting-vegetable-like creatures, forced from their subterranean lair by underground nuclear tests. It's up to a small band of survivors, left behind in the vacated metropolis, to save mankind from these spear-toting boogeymen.

TRIVIA: featured in Michael J. Weldon's Psychotronic Encyclopedia of Film, an 815-page compilation of mini-reviews of over 3,000 cult films.

sources.title: THEY'RE BACK AT THE BIJOU! (double feature)
sources.description: Those pesky undocumemted space aliens are again raising hell. This time it’s in Europe and the U.K. in this simulated second-run house double feature program. The mayhem begins with coming attractions and a cartoon followed by the killer plants from outer space in John Wyndham’s “The Day of the Triffids.” Next interstella migrants turn nice British scientists into nasties in “They Came from Beyond Space.” They're like from nowhere, man! CAST NOTE: If You were wondering what happened to Robert Hutton after “The Slime People,” now you know. https://archive.org/details/TheSlimePeopleTrailer2

metadata.Plot: After Los Angeles is invaded by an army of subterranean monsters, a small group of people must fight for survival in the deserted metropolis.
metadata.Actors: Robert Hutton, Les Tremayne, Robert Burton
